column4: Is there an application I can run on the command line, piping in data that will as a result go into the clipboard?
Well, the clipboard is an X thing
But... there is xclip which does that.
You need to install it first though

I have to point out that it uses the global X keyboard, not your desktops. So, middle-click to paste what has been copied by xclip. You can also just select some text and middle-click to paste the selected text, works in any desktop
Seems that I cannot paste using programs menus, I have to use the middle mouse button
In other words, ubuntu has its own clipboard that xclip does not interact with
Gnome has it's own clipboard, yeah
